Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
LH \LH\ n. (Biochem.) An abbreviation for luteinizing hormone, a gonadotropic hormone that is secreted by the pituitary and stimulates ovulation in female mammals, and stimulates androgen release in male mammals. [Acronym]
Syn: luteinizing hormone, interstitial cell-stimulating hormone. [WordNet 1.5]

LH n : a gonadotropic hormone that is secreted by the anterior pituitary; stimulates ovulation in female mammals and stimulates androgen release in male mammals [syn: {luteinizing hormone}, {interstitial cell-stimulating hormone}, {ICSH}]
